overview: Pushed to the brink by the coronavirus pandemic, a 28-year-old man with no earnings and only around 300 yen (about $3) in his pocket chose to move to Tokyo to become an Uber Eats rider. For a month starting April 2020, when the country's first state of emergency was declared, he kept cycling around Japan's capital, filming himself and the cityscape using his smartphone and a small camera.
title: Tokyo Uber Blues
